content.description: The route has quality rock with the crux up high.
content.protection: Bring nuts and cams to #3.  Bolted anchor at the summit.
content.location: The start will be obvious and has a nice rope-up spot.  Two ropes needed to get back to the ground.  Nice area and beautiful backdrop, a lifetime of climbs awaits.

content.description: I guess the crux is missing one of the bolts and continuing straight up instead of angling right.  Rock quality is not the best.  The first pitch has two bolts and one piton, at the piton angle right to locate the second bolt.  If you continue upward from the piton the grade will much more difficult than 5.5.  The second pitch continues straight up from the belay.  Nice cracks take you to the summit.
content.protection: Gear to #3 cams.  Two bolts and one piton.
content.location: The start of the route is around the corner to the right of Last Fandango.  Starts on a ledge.  Two rope rappel off bolted anchor, same as Last Fandango.

content.description: A secluded 180 foot spire with two routes and possibilities for at least one more.  The rock is good and protects nicely, at least for the route The Last Fandango.  The route The Grope has a fair share of rotten and loose rock.
